profile.name: hardmaru
profile.bio: I make simple things with neural networks.

analysis.career_trajectory: Started with JavaScript in 2018, exploring various deep learning frameworks like PyTorch-NEAT, TensorFlow, and Chainer RL. In 2020, they began working on reinforcement learning projects using OpenAI Baselines and Gym. They also experimented with Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs) and Variational Autoencoders (VAEs). In recent years, their focus has shifted to World Models and Evolution Strategies. They have also been involved in various research papers and open-source projects.

comment_analytics.communication_style: Asks deep architectural questions, provides detailed explanations of their research and projects.

match_profile.similar_user_traits: A researcher with a strong background in reinforcement learning and generative models.
conversation_starters: What inspired you to explore World Models?
How do you think Generative Adversarial Networks can be applied to real-world problems?
Can you walk me through your experience with Chainerrl?
